7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:34): on slashdot, in the IE10 thread, one message stuck me as particularly insightful: ‚Äúten? my browser version goes up to eleven!‚Äù

8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (15:34): More like, nobody cares about version numbers, so we just picked the easiest one
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (15:34): Mmm, but most likely I'm doing it wrong again *tries again*

2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (15:39): Despite different installation locations and different profiles.
da5121879fff54b08b69ec54d9ac2bf6 (15:40): 5 is being skipped again? :P
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:40): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: Opera had better stop tweaking minor version to stay ahead of Chrome

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:41): 76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc: Opera is the one that goes to 11. Chrome's stable release is still at 10.
70146b691c63925cce03ef59b5c93127 (15:41): WebKit over five hundred
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:42): 70146b691c63925cce03ef59b5c93127: yet, Apple ships Safari as 5. They are missing a hundredfold win here.
76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc (15:42): If user agent says me it's Opera/9.80, it must be it... (I'm kinda confused on browsers user agents)
da5121879fff54b08b69ec54d9ac2bf6 (15:42): 76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc: Yes, thanks to broken browser sniffing scripts, 10 < 9.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:43): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: So there's now moz-central, aurora, beta, and final?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:43): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: yes
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:43): Opera 9.80 is the eternal version.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:43): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: except the beta channel will take 6 weeks to appear
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (15:44): I wonder what aurora and nightly are sharing together now that you cannot run them at the same time.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:44): So what's the flow from moz-central to Aurora?
76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc (15:44): All I do is checking by proper header if browser accepts xhtml+xml header and send it if it supports.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:44): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: every 6 weeks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:45): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: the first ever move from central to aurora happened on Tuesday this week

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: So for something to ship you have possibly just under six weeks m-c to Aurora, six weeks to Beta, then six weeks to Final? So everything has a 12‚Äì18 week lead time?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:45): Compared with Chrome's 6‚Äì12 week lead time?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:45): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: in six weeks, current aurora becomes beta and a new aurora begins with what's in central
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:46): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Right, yeah. But to get from central to final takes 12‚Äì18 weeks, if I understand correctly?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:46): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: yeah
76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc (15:47): If my document validates to XHTML5, it's probably good :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:47): finds the difference (by having another stage) between Fx and Ch interesting
76680563b02870d015080e95984df8fc (15:48): It's not like HTML5 is cure for all problems. I just use it for semantic elements and placeholder="".
